sentence.Network_en: The police had searched the house from cellar to rafter.
sentence.Network_cn: 警察已把那座房子上上下下搜遍了.

sentence.Network_en: RAFTER was not well received. At first it was just a rustle.
sentence.Network_cn: “筏夫”并未受到欢迎.起初只是出现一阵低语声.

sentence.Network_en: When the hell did you say you developed this RAFTER?
sentence.Network_cn: 你说你到底在什么时候研究出了这个“筏夫”?

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English ræfter, of Germanic origin: related to raft

entry.def: Rafters are the sloping pieces of wood that support a roof.

example.ex: From the rafters of the thatched roofs hung strings of dried onions and garlic.
example.tran: 茅草屋顶的椽子上挂着几串干洋葱和蒜。

means.word_mean: 1. one of several parallel sloping beams that support a roof

sentences.en: Shine the torch up into the rafters,please.
